private_information: type: truck
speed: 3
can drive between places; travel time = distance(from,to)/speed
during driving it is not at any place
truck0.goal: Assist in transporting crates between places to achieve the global crate placement goals.

private_information: type: truck
speed: 2
can drive between places; travel time = distance(from,to)/speed
during driving it is not at any place
truck1.goal: Assist in transporting crates between places to achieve the global crate placement goals.

private_information: type: hoist
power: 1
can lift, put-down, load into truck, unload from truck; load/unload duration = weight(crate)/power
stays at its place when operating
hoist0.goal: Handle moving crates at its location and cooperate to achieve the global crate placement goals.

private_information: type: hoist
power: 6
can lift, put-down, load into truck, unload from truck; load/unload duration = weight(crate)/power
stays at its place when operating
hoist1.goal: Handle moving crates at its location and cooperate to achieve the global crate placement goals.

stays at its place when operating

hoist3.goal: Handle moving crates at its location and cooperate to achieve the global crate placement goals.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate trucks and hoists to produce a PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global crate placement goals while respecting agent constraints and minimizing total time.

public_information: Trucks move between places; travel duration = distance(from,to)/speed(truck).
Hoists operate at places; lift/put durations depend on crate weight and hoist power.
Crates, pallets, trucks, and hoists are locatable objects.
Surfaces can support crates; crates can be surfaces for other crates.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent temporal PDDL modeling for logistics. You will be given the full environment description and agent capabilities. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models trucks and hoists, with temporal actions, numeric fluents for durations, and constraints so plans minimize total-time. Keep actions distinct per agent type and respect the given capacities, speeds, powers, distances, and initial state.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The truck0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}.
The truck1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
The hoist0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}.
The hoist1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}.
The hoist2's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}.
The hoist3's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}.
The hoist4's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}.
The hoist5's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
